rocks.bastion.core

Interface HttpRequest

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FormUrlEncodedRequest, GeneralRequest, JsonRequest

    public interface HttpRequest
    Defines an HTTP request for Bastion to send as part of a test.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object body()
      An object that will serve as a content body for this request.
      Optional<org.apache.http.entity.ContentType> contentType()
      The content type header to use for this request.
      Collection<ApiHeader> headers()
      A collection of HTTP headers that will be included with this request.
      HttpMethod method()
      Returns the HTTP method to use for sending this request.
      String name()
      Returns a descriptive name for the contents of this request object.
      Collection<ApiQueryParam> queryParams()
      A collection of HTTP query parameters that will be used for performing this request.
      Collection<RouteParam> routeParams()
      A collection of route parameter assignments that will be replaced in the URL.
      String url()
      Returns the URL which this HTTP request will be sent to.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Returns a descriptive name for the contents of this request object.
        Returns:
        Description of this request

      • url

        String url()
        Returns the URL which this HTTP request will be sent to.
        Returns:
        A non-null remote URL for this request

      • method

        HttpMethod method()
        Returns the HTTP method to use for sending this request. Can be one of the constants from HttpMethod or a custom HTTP method which is non-standard.
        Returns:
        A non-null HTTP method for this request

      • contentType

        Optional<org.apache.http.entity.ContentType> contentType()
        The content type header to use for this request. This includes the MIME type of the content body, an optional character set of the request and other parameters, if necessary (such as quality parameter).
        Returns:
        An optional content type to use for this request. Return an empty Optional if you would like to leave the content-type header undefined for this request.

      • headers

        Collection<ApiHeader> headers()
        A collection of HTTP headers that will be included with this request. Note that Bastion will automatically include the "Content-type" header using the value returned by contentType() if, and only if, the collection returned by this method does not contain a header for "Content-type." This means that this method should not return a "Content-type" header as part of the collection unless you want to override the content-type returned by the contentType() method.
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of HTTP header to include with the request

      • queryParams

        Collection<ApiQueryParam> queryParams()
        A collection of HTTP query parameters that will be used for performing this request. Query parameters are typically appended to the end of an URL following a question mark symbol.
        Returns:
        A non-null collection of query parameters for this request

      • routeParams

        Collection<RouteParam> routeParams()

        A collection of route parameter assignments that will be replaced in the URL. For example, the following URL:

        http://sushi.test/{id}/ingredients

        The URL above contains one route parameter called "id" which can be assigned a numerical value which will be replaced when the actual HTTP takes place.

        Returns:
        A non-null collection of route parameters for this request.

      • body

        Object body()
        An object that will serve as a content body for this request. Can be null if this request will not send a body. Bastion may use the content-type of this request, returned by the contentType() method, as well as the runtime type of the object returned by this method to determine how best to serialize the returned object into the HTTP request's body.
        Returns:
        An object that will serve as the content body for this request. May be null.
